intro: Myosotis scorpioides subsp. laxa, commonly known as the loose bluebell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a soft, hairy texture. It is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense clusters in its natural habitat.
